ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Vanished has my power from me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and our belief has destroyed us".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: My power has gone from me!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: My authority is gone away from me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: my authority is gone from me.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: My power hath gone from me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: There hath perished from me my authority.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: My power has perished from me!"...
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: My power and arguments (to defend myself) have gone from me!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and my authority has been destroyed'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: My power has vanished from me.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Gone from me is my authority."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:29] My authority, my strength, my argument, has gone from me’ (the [final] hā’ in kitābiyah, ‘my book’, hisābiyah, ‘my account’, and sultāniyah, ‘my authority’, is for [consonantal] quiescence; and it is retained [when reciting] with a pause as well as without a pause, in accordance with the authoritative [version of the] Qur’ānic text and the transmitted reports; some elide it when reciting without a pause).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (My power hath gone from me) I am without arguments or excuses.
